page.title: 04Whiteley Village-Facilities
page.content: The gardens outside each cottage were looked after by the residents and there was a competition each year for the best one. The houses were decorated every 7 years and the residents moved into another house for about 3 weeks while this was being done. All the houses are decorated in the same way, so they do not choose the colours.They are built in a lovely red brick, with some interesting twisted pillars in the porches. Shops in the village include a general post office and a green-grocer. A butcher and a fish van also visited the village weekly. There was a library, a hairdresser (who called each week) and a shoe repair service.A daily bus service visits all the local towns,and this is very popular with the residents.
